tables.table_schema: CREATE TABLE users (user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
user_id INT,
role_id INT,
PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id),
FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id),
FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(id)
)
CREATE TABLE users ( user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(100), password VARCHAR(100), email VARCHAR(255), role VARCHAR(50) );
CREATE TABLE roles ( role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50), description VARCHAR(255) );
CREATE TABLE resources ( resource_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, resource_name VARCHAR(100), resource_type VARCHAR(50), description VARCHAR(255) );

CREATE TABLE permissions ( permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, role_id UUID, resource_id UUID, grant_type VARCHAR(10), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(role_id), FOREIGN KEY (resource_id) REFERENCES resources(resource_id) );

CREATE TABLE user_permissions ( user_id UUID, permission_id UUID, grant_type VARCHAR(10), FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id), FOREIGN KEY (permission_id) REFERENCES permissions(permission_id), PRIMARY KEY (user_id, permission_id) );
